intro: Calceolaria subscaposa, commonly known as the scapose slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its unique slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which help it adapt to its arid or semi-arid habitats. Calceolaria subscaposa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and relatively easy care requirements.
